body.p: The DocBook Topic document type was introduced with DocBook 5.1 and it is used as a modular unit of documentation. It is similar to the concept of the DITA Topic and can be used as modular resources in conjunction with DocBook 5.1 Assembly documents.
For detailed information about the DocBook Topic document type, see DocBook 5.1: The Definitive Guide - Topic.

section.title: File Definition
section.p: A DocBook file is considered to be a Topic when the root name is topic.

section.title: Default Document Templates
section.p: A default Topic document template is available when creating new documents from templatesnew documents from templates in: Framework Templates DocBook 5 DocBook 5.1 .
The default template for DocBook Assembly documents is located in the /frameworks/docbook/templates/Docbook5.1 folder.

section.title: Default Schema for Validation and Content Completion
section.p: The default schema that is used if one is not detected is docbookxi.rng and it is stored in /frameworks/docbook/5.1/rng/.

section.title: Transformation Scenarios
section.p: Since DocBook Topics are modular resources, they are assembled and transformed in the DocBook Assembly transformation process. You can also use any of the built-in DocBook transformation scenarios to transform individual DocBook Topics to a variety of outputs, such as PDF, HTML, EPUB, and more. They are found in the DocBook 5 section in the Configure Transformation Scenario(s) dialog box.
